definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他们在女娲身旁欢呼雀跃了一阵，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: They ooh and aah when the thousands of little lights in the ball come on.
sentences.chinese: 当球上的数千盏小灯亮起时，人群一阵欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: They cheered when the result was announced.
sentences.chinese: 投票结果公布后，她们欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: The team whooped it up after winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 该队在比赛获胜后欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: They cheered and cheered. The hall seemed boiling.
sentences.chinese: 他们欢呼雀跃，大厅里像开锅了似的。

sentences.english: We exulted in the school team's victory.
sentences.chinese: 我们为校队的胜利欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: He jumps up with joy for those mediaeval castles on the mountaintop.
sentences.chinese: 他为山顶上那些中世纪的城堡而欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: Wan Min jubilation, cheered, China's north and south corners of the country spring tide surging.
sentences.chinese: 万民欢腾，欢呼雀跃，中国南北，五湖四海春潮涌动。

sentences.english: The people, rising in their seats and waving hats and handkerchiefs, cheered and cheered.
sentences.chinese: 观众都站了起来，欢呼雀跃，挥舞着帽子和手帕。
很多欧洲人忍不住要欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: The birth of a baby is usually an occasion for joy.
sentences.chinese: 人们因孩子的出生而欢欢喜喜欢呼雀跃。

sentences.english: While foreign unions cheer, multinational companies fret.
sentences.chinese: 尽管外国工会欢呼雀跃，但是跨国公司却愁眉不展。
整个核工业界为这次“核文艺复兴”欢呼雀跃。

definition: happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
